Card.Name: AOE Tower
Card.Description: slow, but attacks everything in range

Card.Name: Blood Mage Tower
Card.Description: Powerful, but also very dangerous.

Card.Name: Chain Gun
Card.Description: Best suited as a last line of defense

Card.Name: Challenger Tower
Card.Description: Even more dangerous than you think it is

Card.Name: Champion Tower
Card.Description: For when you really want a fight

Card.Name: Construction Yard
Card.Description: provides a steady supply of additional towers.

Card.Name: Death Ray
Card.Description: Fires at a blisteringly fast pace and at great range, but dont build it until you really need it

Card.Name: Explosive Tower
Card.Description: Deals splash damage. Good for tightly-packed enemies.

Card.Name: Fast Sniper
Card.Description: Specializes in finishing off weak foes

Card.Name: Fast Tower
Card.Description: Suitable for fighting swarms

Card.Name: Giant Sniper
Card.Description: Variation of Sniper Tower that specializes in slaying giants

Card.Name: Heavy Overcharge Tower
Card.Description: Very powerful, but choose wisely when to fire.

Card.Name: Heavy Tower
Card.Description: Suitable for fighting tanks

Card.Name: Improvised Tower
Card.Description: There were no towers in your deck, but you managed to improvise something regardless.

Card.Name: Magic Academy
Card.Description: provides a steady supply of additional spells.

Card.Name: Modular Tower
Card.Description: Weak, but has a far larger capacity for upgrades than any other tower

Card.Name: Mortar Tower
Card.Description: Creates explosions near your mouse

Card.Name: Mouse Tower
Card.Description: Targets enemies near your mouse

Card.Name: Nova Tower
Card.Description: The fury of a single sun tends to be sufficient

Card.Name: Ping Tower
Card.Description: Rapid waves of damage that excel at fighting large groups

Card.Name: Pylon
Card.Description: provides a steady supply of additional cards from the deck.

Card.Name: Shredder Tower
Card.Description: Does very little damage, but strips away armor

Card.Name: Slowing Tower
Card.Description: Does not deal damage, but slows enemies down so other towers have more time to hit them

Card.Name: Sniper Tower
Card.Description: Specializes in slaying heavily armored foes

Card.Name: Supernova Tower
Card.Description: Fury of a thousand suns

Card.Name: Swarm Tower
Card.Description: Unleashes a massive hail of explosive bullets that attacks everything on the map

Card.Name: Workshop
Card.Description: provides a steady supply of additional upgrades.

Card.Name: Basic Upgrade
Card.Description: Boring but good

Card.Name: Blood Magic Upgrade
Card.Description: The faster the tower, the more dangerous this upgrade is: both for you and the enemy.

Card.Name: Chain Hit
Card.Description: Powerful, but easily squandered

Card.Name: Crippling Ammo
Card.Description: allows attacks to ignore armor

Card.Name: Crossfire Upgrade
Card.Description: Quite powerful, but only on strategically placed towers.

Card.Name: Double-Barrel Upgrade
Card.Description: Best on towers that dont already have specialized targeting

Card.Name: Explosive Ammo
Card.Description: Causes attacks to explode on impact

Card.Name: Fast Upgrade
Card.Description: small damage increase per shot. best on fast towers

Card.Name: Heavy Upgrade
Card.Description: Best on towers with high damage

Card.Name: Improvised Upgrade
Card.Description: There were no upgrades in your deck, but you managed to improvise something regardless.

Card.Name: Manual Control
Card.Description: If you want a job done right, then do it yourself.

Card.Name: Mouse Upgrade
Card.Description: allows you to micromanage what the tower attacks at great range

Card.Name: Overcharge Upgrade
Card.Description: Allows a tower to build up extra power if it doesnt attack for a while

Card.Name: Override Safeties
Card.Description: Overrides tower safety mechanisms, squeezing out more power but making the tower decay faster.

Card.Name: Piercing Ammo
Card.Description: allows attacks to ignore armor

Card.Name: Poison Ammo
Card.Description: Dishes out a lot of damage, but takes a long time to do it

Card.Name: Preservation Upgrade
Card.Description: Don't leave me!

Card.Name: Pulse Upgrade
Card.Description: Adds a secondary area attack

Card.Name: Quad-Barrel Upgrade
Card.Description: less damage, but effective against groups

Card.Name: Range Upgrade
Card.Description: Long arm of the law.

Card.Name: Self-Destruct Upgrade
Card.Description: Tower becomes very powerful, but will only get one shot.

Card.Name: Slow Decay
Card.Description: Keeps a tower around even if it cant be upgraded any further

Card.Name: Slow Growth
Card.Description: best used on a tower that will stick around for a while even without further upgrades

Card.Name: Spitfire Upgrade
Card.Description: Quantity over quality.

Card.Name: Tower Insurance
Card.Description: Brings a tower back to you after it dies

Effect.name: customDescription
Effect.argument: All incoming enemies become the same type, chosen at random.

Card.Name: Conjuration
Card.Description: rather unpredictable

Card.Name: Conjure Spell
Card.Description: Something from nothing, but will it be helpful?

Card.Name: Conjure Tower
Card.Description: Something from nothing, but will it be helpful?

Card.Name: Conjure Upgrade
Card.Description: Something from nothing, but will it be helpful?

Card.Name: Construction Funding
Card.Description: for those times you REALLY need more towers.

Effect.name: customDescription
Effect.argument: All towers get Crippling, Piercing, and Poison ammo

Card.Name: Desperation Conjuration
Card.Description: With a side of alliteration

Card.Name: Enfeeble
Card.Description: Putting the bear to sleep.

Card.Name: Enrage
Card.Description: Poking the bear.

Card.Name: Focus Power: Spells
Card.Description: Redirects all your efforts towards spellcasting.

Card.Name: Focus Power: Towers
Card.Description: Redirects all your efforts towards creation of towers.

Card.Name: Focus Power: Upgrades
Card.Description: Redirects all your efforts towards improving your towers.

Card.Name: Gambit
Card.Description: Feeling lucky?

Card.Name: Gather Power
Card.Description: Gives you more to work with, but attracts more enemies. Usable once per round

Card.Name: Heavy Shield
Card.Description: Very effective, but rather unwieldy

Card.Name: Improvisation
Card.Description: You're pretty sure you can cobble something together

Card.Name: Improvised Spell
Card.Description: There were no spells in your deck, but you managed to improvise something regardless.

Card.Name: Infrastructure Funding
Card.Description: for those times you REALLY need more upgrades.

Card.Name: Life Tap
Card.Description: Power comes at a cost

Card.Name: Light Shield
Card.Description: Use ths to protect more important cards from harm. Best used every round.

Card.Name: Program Funding
Card.Description: for those times you REALLY need more upgrades.

Card.Name: Recycle
Card.Description: Does not guarantee your new hand will be better than the one you have.

Card.Name: Reinforce
Card.Description: quite useful, but attracts unwanted attention

Card.Name: Risky Draw
Card.Description: Only a 16.5% chance of disaster!

Card.Name: Shield
Card.Description: Use ths to protect more important cards from harm. Best used when you expect to take damage.

Card.Name: Strong Reinforce
Card.Description: extremely useful, but attracts unwanted attention and consumes upgrade slots

Card.Name: Summon Armored
Card.Description: Easily defeated with the proper defenses, but very dangerous otherwise

Card.Name: Summon Assassin
Card.Description: Despite the name, they have nothing to do with butts.

Card.Name: Summon Carrier
Card.Description: They speak loudly and carry a lot of small sticks.

Card.Name: Summon Giant
Card.Description: Just dont ask them about the weather.

Card.Name: Summon Regenerative Tank
Card.Description: Not advised if your defenses are too spread out

Card.Name: Summon Scrambled
Card.Description: WARNING: does not summon scrambled eggs

Card.Name: Summon Standard
Card.Description: Lets you and I get normal for a change.

Card.Name: Summon Tank
Card.Description: Bring it on!

Card.Name: Time Crunch
Card.Description: Condensing the onslaught
